units.summary: Native American society before European Contact, European exploration in the New World, Exploration in the new World

events.title: Columbus arrives in the New World
events.description: Sparks flow of trade between old and new world. Stimulates food production and growth. Spain becomes colonial power in the Americas

units.summary: Colonies established in the New World by the Spanish, French, Dutch, and British
American Revolution, the events that led up to it, and the formation of the United States

presidents.name: George Washington
presidents.description: First President of the United States

events.title: Declaration of Independence
events.description: Articulated the principle of individual liberty and government's responsibility to serve the government's economy

events.title: Judiciary Act of 1789
events.description: Established courts below the Supreme Court

events.title: French Revolution
events.description: Social and political upheaval in France that allowed the U.S. to expand its territory

events.title: Bill of Rights is ratified
events.description: First ten amendments to the Constitution: (1) Freedom of speech, press, religion, assembly, and petition; (2) Right to bear arms; (3) No quartering of soldiers; (4) No unreasonable search and seizure; (5) Due process of law; (6) Right to a speedy trial; (7) Right to a jury trial in civil cases; (8) No cruel and unusual punishment; (9) Rights not enumerated in the Constitution are still protected; (10) Powers not given to the federal government are reserved for the states

events.title: Federal Bank is established
events.description: Federal Bank proposed by Alexander Hamilton to stabilize the economy and establish credit

events.title: Whiskey Rebellion
events.description: Farmers in Pennsylvania rebelled against tax on whiskey; Washington sent troops to put down rebellion, expressing power of the government

events.title: Jay Treaty
events.description: Settle disputes between U.S. and Britain over trade and territory

events.title: 1796 Presidential Election
events.description: George Washington steps down after two terms

events.description: George Washington steps down after two terms
